site_title: The mutual fund at 100: Is it becoming obsolete?
summary: Mutual funds, which have managed nearly $20 trillion in US assets and $63 trillion worldwide, are facing challenges from newer rivals that promise tax advantages, lower fees, and rapid trading. The industry's dominance is under threat, with US mutual funds suffering over $1 trillion in net outflows from 2021 to 2023. Exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have amassed over $2 trillion in inflows in the US since 2021, including $575 billion last year. Industry observers predict that the glory days of mutual funds are ending, with some predicting that they could become "irrelevant" unless asset managers adapt to changing investor demands. Despite this, many investors still prefer the simplicity and advantages of mutual funds, and the product is unlikely to disappear anytime soon.

images.alt_text: (FILES) A picture taken on February 6, 2018 shows a person holding a visual representation of the digital crypto-currency Bitcoin, at the "Bitcoin Change" shop in the Israeli city of Tel Aviv. Bitcoin hit another record high Friday, March 8, smashing through $70,000 for the first time on growing investor demand amid speculation over when the United States may begin lowering interest rates. (Photo by JACK GUEZ / AFP)
Fidelity has been in China since 2004 and has a local staff of almost 2,000 people, mostly in technology and operations.
BlackRock is among big money managers, including Wellington Management and T Rowe Price Group, that have recently cut jobs and redirected budgets in response.

site_title: Baltic Exchange Shipping Insights
summary: The global shipping market showed signs of recovery this week, with tanker and dry bulk rates increasing across various routes. The Capesize market surged past $10.00 on C5, driven by strong demand from South Brazil and West Africa to China. The North Atlantic saw moderate activity, with rates supported by tonnage tightening. The BCI 5TC rose by $2,817 on the day and gained $3,660 over the week to close at $20,084. Despite some volatility, the market ended on a positive note.

images.alt_text: A roundup of the week’s tanker and dry bulk market (Feb 28, 2025).

site_title: Microsoft to pay Inflection AI US$650 million after scooping up most of staff
summary: Microsoft has agreed to pay Inflection AI $650 million, primarily to license its AI software and hire most of its 70 employees, in an "acqui-hire" deal without an acquisition. The deal includes $620 million for AI models and $30 million for waiving legal rights. Microsoft's move may still raise antitrust concerns with US regulators, who are scrutinizing Big Tech's AI investments. Inflection's investors will receive a modest return on investment, while the startup shifts to an enterprise business model and retains its proprietary technology.

images.alt_text: Bing in China has been removing an increasing amount of information about human rights, democracy, climate change and other topics to satisfy Beijing.
Apple takes a cut from every purchase made on its App Store.

Mustafa Suleyman is one of the biggest names in the artificial intelligence revolution that is taking the technology world by storm and his hiring is a major move by Microsoft, which already partners with ChatGPT creator OpenAI.

site_title: Private-home sub-sales continue to hit new highs in 2023
summary: Singapore's private-home sub-sales reached a decade-high in 2023 with 1,294 transactions, a 69.2% jump from the previous year. This is the second consecutive year of strong growth, driven by rising home values and delayed project completions due to the pandemic. Sub-sales accounted for 9.5% of all transactions in Q4 2023, with a median capital gain of S$243,500 and an annualized profit of 22.3%. The profit figures exclude transaction costs, and the highest profit was S$864,000 for a 2,067 sq ft terrace house sold in October.

images.alt_text: Ry-Anne Lim
With homebuyers being selective, private housing projects may see widely diverging sales take-up rates at launches.
Close to a third of the respondents who took part in the survey felt that there is an oversupply of property agents in the market.
The XXX continued to lead in condo and private apartment sales, accounting for XXX per cent of sales in February.

site_title: Massimo Bottura and the importance of knowing where you come from
summary: Celebrated Italian chef Massimo Bottura has opened his new restaurant, Torno Subito, in Singapore's Dempsey, marking his third restaurant in Asia. The restaurant, a tie-up with the Como Group, features a playful 1960s Italy-influenced decor and serves traditional Italian dishes rooted in its Emilia-Romagna heritage. Bottura emphasizes the importance of "Tradition in Evolution" and creating future leaders in the culinary world, while his new restaurant aims to provide a joyful and whimsical experience, reminiscent of his childhood summers by the Adriatic Riviera.

images.alt_text: Andre Chiang returns to Singapore for a two week pop-up event.

site_title: George Lucas backs Disney CEO Iger in proxy battle with Nelson Peltz
summary: Film producer George Lucas has backed Disney CEO Bob Iger in the company's proxy battle against activist investor Nelson Peltz and hedge fund Blackwells Capital. Lucas, who owns 37.1 million Disney shares, expressed confidence in Iger's leadership and urged other shareholders to re-elect the company's directors. Lucas, a long-time admirer of Disney, has voted all his shares for the directors and cited Iger's track record of driving long-term value. The endorsement comes after proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis also urged shareholders to re-elect the directors.

images.alt_text: Disney has received powerful endorsements from hedge fund ValueAct Capital, and JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon.
Disney has outlined some of its succession planning in regulatory filings.

site_title: Europe: Luxury stocks pressure equities ahead of Fed verdict
summary: European stocks ended flat on Wednesday, pressured by a 1.3% decline in luxury stocks, led by Kering's 11.9% drop. The sector's woes are attributed to a worsening slowdown in demand for luxury goods, exacerbated by China's economic slowdown. Despite this, other stocks like Lonza and Johnson Matthey rose due to deal announcements. Investors remain focused on the Federal Reserve's meeting later in the day, expecting interest rates to remain unchanged.

images.alt_text: The three major US indices pushed to all-time closing records on Wednesday, with the Nasdaq gaining the most at 1.3 per cent.

US Federal Reserve Board Chair Jerome Powell announced the central bank stayed on track for three interest rate cuts this year and affirmed that solid economic growth will continue, Washington, DC, March 20, 2024.

site_title: Watchdog tells Britain's payments sector to brace for intervention
summary: Britain's Payments Regulator announced plans for "targeted intervention" to boost competition in the sector, amid pressure to make it easier for fintechs to enter. The regulator is exploring ways to expand "open banking" and allow third-party payment firms to access bank accounts with customer permission. The goal is to remove barriers to innovation and address "pockets of market power" that leave customers paying higher fees. Regulator managing director Chris Hemsley indicated that some mandatory changes are likely, including mandating the participation of sending firms.

images.alt_text: In the first quarter of 2023, 95.1 per cent of the UK population is within a mile of a free-to-use cash withdrawal point, according to FCA.

site_title: Like it or not, gender-neutral clothes are coming for you
summary: Singapore's home-grown brand Graye has successfully expanded its business to two stores, thanks to its gender-neutral clothes. Founder Xie Qian Qian believes the brand is going in the right direction with its neutral silhouettes. The trend of gender-neutral fashion is gaining momentum, with top designers and brands such as Issey Miyake, Yohji Yamamoto, and Voiddeck embracing the concept. A recent survey found that about half of online shoppers have bought fashion items that are not traditionally associated with their gender. The upcoming Fashion For All festival in Singapore will feature brands with more inclusive perspectives on clothing design.

images.alt_text: Helmi Yusof
Today’s hottest silhouettes and aesthetics may be borrowed from times past, but they’re still chock-full of modern flair.

site_title: World Bank to share more data to attract private investors to developing countries
summary: The World Bank plans to publish more of its proprietary data, including debt defaults, to attract private sector investment to developing countries. World Bank President Ajay Banga announced the move to inspire investor confidence, citing the need to overcome barriers to private sector investment in developing economies. The bank has already mobilized $41 billion of private capital and aims to raise more this year. The bank will also publish private sector recovery data by county income level and sovereign default and recovery rate statistics, starting next week.

images.alt_text: Apple battles falling iPhone sales in China and rising competition from domestic rivals such as Huawei.

site_title: US: Megacaps’ rally lifts tech-heavy Nasdaq at open
summary: US stocks opened higher on Monday, driven by a rally in megacap growth stocks and chipmakers. The Nasdaq Composite rose 1.14% to 16,154.92, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 0.29% to 38,826.93. The S&P 500 also opened higher, up 0.74% to 5,154.77. The tech-heavy Nasdaq's recovery is seen ahead of the US Federal Reserve's meeting this week.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York City, U.S., August 15, 2023.  REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo

site_title: Elon Musk defends ketamine use, dismisses investor worries
summary: Elon Musk has defended his use of ketamine, a medication typically used for pain management and depression, stating it helps him manage his "negative frame of mind." He took the anesthetic "a small amount once every other week" and denied abusing it, saying it benefits Tesla investors who should be concerned about his success. Musk also discussed meeting with Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump and expressed his leaning away from Democratic President Joe Biden, but did not commit to supporting Trump.

images.alt_text: The company on Mar 1 also raised the prices of its Model Y rear-wheel drive and long-range vehicles by US$1,000 to US$43,990 and US$48,990, respectively.
At Meta Platforms, Mark Zuckerberg effectively cannot be ousted as CEO because dual-class shares give him super-voting rights.

site_title: Korean Air nears deal for about 20 Airbus A350 widebody jets
summary: Korean Air is near a deal to purchase around 20 Airbus A350 widebody jets, marking its first widebody purchase since 2019. The order is part of the airline's efforts to simplify its fleet after its merger with Asiana Airlines. The deal could be announced as early as this week, pending a board meeting on March 21. This move is a significant win for Airbus, which has been competing with Boeing for the airline's widebody needs.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Korean Airlines is seen on a B787-9 plane at its aviation shed in Incheon, South Korea, February 27, 2017.  REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/

site_title: Cryptoverse: AI tokens outpace record-breaking Bitcoin
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) crypto tokens have outpaced Bitcoin's growth over the past year, with their combined market value reaching $26.4 billion. AI-linked tokens have surged between 145% and 297% in the past 30 days, driven by investor appetite for machine-learning applications. Industry predictions suggest crypto and blockchain technology could solve AI's teething problems, and some market watchers believe AI applications could become "crypto's raison d'être." Investment manager VanEck predicts revenue from AI crypto projects could reach $10.2 billion by 2030.

images.alt_text: Asia accounted for US$791 billion of the US$1.17 trillion worth of Bitcoin traded in February, with North American investors lagging way behind with US$113 billion, broadly reflecting a trend seen since November
Bitcoin's resurgence has electrified the broader cryptocurrency market, including Ether and other digital coins, which has now exceeded US$2 trillion, as per data from CoinGecko.
The entrance of the world’s largest cryptocurrency into the world’s largest stock market “marks the end of the beginning of Bitcoin’s maturation and growing-up phase.

site_title: Malaysia inflation up 1.8% in February, beating economists’ forecast
summary: Malaysia's inflation rate increased 1.8% year-on-year in February, beating economists' forecast of 1.4%. The rise was driven by higher utility charges and transport costs, offsetting easing food prices. Core inflation also rose 1.8% in February, matching January's growth. This marks the first time inflation has surpassed the forecast in three consecutive months since November.

images.alt_text: Tan Ai Leng
Bank Negara Malaysia governor Abdul Rasheed Ghaffour said: "Our prospects are good. We have reason to cautiously anticipate a better year ahead."

site_title: Europe: Financials, energy boost shares; central bank verdicts eyed
summary: Europe's Stoxx 600 index rose 0.3% on Tuesday, snapping a three-day losing streak, driven by gains in the financial and energy sectors. Oil prices hit four-month highs, and financial stocks led the way, with Commerzbank climbing 1.1%. Investors await central bank decisions, including the US Federal Reserve's monetary policy decision and the Bank of England's interest rate verdict. Meanwhile, the European Central Bank is poised to initiate a rate-cut cycle in June, according to policymakers.

images.alt_text: All three major indices advanced on Tuesday, with the S&P 500 at 5,178.51, up 0.6 per cent, topping a record set a week ago.

site_title: Malaysia’s capital market grows 5.6% in 2023 despite lower fundraising: Securities Commission
summary: Malaysia's capital market grew 5.6% in 2023 to RM3.8 trillion, driven by growth in local bourses, bonds, and sukuk market. Despite lower fundraising activities, the market remained resilient. Total funds raised moderated to RM127.7 billion, down from a record high in 2022. The Securities Commission attributed the growth to improved market value and asset allocation in developed markets, as well as the depreciation of the ringgit. The domestic equity market is among the best performing in the region, with the FBM KLCI gaining over 6% in the year to date.

images.alt_text: Tan Ai Leng
Market analysts are bullish on the uptrend of FBM KLCI to continue, as they anticipate Malaysia’s economic condition will keep improving this year.
The company said proceeds will be used for expansion of new outlets in Malaysia, establishment of new distribution centres and the purchase of delivery trucks, among other things.

site_title: Dessert for dinner? Ami lets you eat cake and more
summary: Ami Patisserie in Singapore offers an unconventional dining experience, where pastry chef Makoto Arami serves an omakase menu that blurs the lines between lunch and dinner. The intimate setting, inspired by a Japanese tea house, features eight mini courses priced at S$118. The menu showcases sweet and savory flavors, with dishes like hazelnut financiers, flaky seaweed pastry, and egg salad-stuffed choux puffs. Ami's innovative approach proves that pastries can be a full-scale meal, challenging traditional dining conventions and offering a unique culinary experience.

images.alt_text: Maison Boulud's spacious dining room.

site_title: Understanding your ‘enough’: An economist changing lives
summary: Denica Riadini-Flesch, founder of SukkhaCitta, a social enterprise selling handmade apparel, has won the Rolex Awards for Enterprise for her efforts to solve problems in the clothing industry. SukkhaCitta, which means "happiness" in Bahasa Indonesia, aims to empower rural artisans in Indonesia by providing fair wages and promoting sustainable practices. The company has impacted over 1,500 lives and has seen a 60% average increase in earnings for its artisans. Riadini-Flesch plans to multiply her craft schools and reach 10,000 lives by 2030, using a regenerative farm-to-closet model that prioritizes the well-being of people and the environment.

images.alt_text: Settling on the right targets for ESG-linked salaries is a hurdle.
Fu’s comments come as countries around the world explore sustainability regulations, some of which could hit SMEs in global supply chains.

site_title: Would Rachmaninoff love a glass of Islay Whisky?
summary: Maduro, a whisky and jazz lounge in Singapore, offers a unique blend of sophisticated ambiance and live music performances. The bar, founded by realtor-turned-bar-owner Peter Ng, aims for an unpretentious atmosphere with exclusivity, featuring a curated selection of independent bottling whiskies and handpicked art pieces. Ng, a classically trained pianist, curates live music performances that take center stage, often paired with tailored whisky or cocktail programs. The bar's rarest gems include Islay Aged 30 Years and Eidolon Port Ellen 1983 Aged 36 Years, offering a platform for emerging musicians and a wide range of whisky flavors to complement its live music nights.

site_title: US: Stocks mostly down as S&P 500 pulls back from record
summary: US stocks fell on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 index retreating from a record after slumping 0.2% to 5,165.31. The Nasdaq Composite Index dropped 0.5% to 16,177.77, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 0.1% to 39,043.32. Investors are eyeing key economic indicators ahead.

images.alt_text: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York City, U.S., March 7, 2024.  REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

site_title: Bitcoin faces ‘sell-the-news’ moment after setting record high
summary: Bitcoin fell 14% after reaching an all-time high of $69,191, with over $800 million worth of bullish positions liquidated in the perpetual futures market. This "sell-the-news" trade follows recent price swings, which have seen annual gains of over 1,000% followed by significant losses. Investors expect Bitcoin to continue rising in the long term, driven by strong inflows into Bitcoin ETFs and the potential for price gains to exceed current levels.

images.alt_text: Asia accounted for US$791 billion of the US$1.17 trillion worth of Bitcoin traded in February, with North American investors lagging way behind with US$113 billion, broadly reflecting a trend seen since November
FILE PHOTO: U.S. Dollar banknotes are seen in this illustration taken July 17, 2022. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo
Bitcoin has gained 50 per cent this year and most of the rise has come in the last few weeks when inflows into US-listed bitcoin funds have surged.

site_title: Thai central bank ramps up steps to cut 91% household debt ratio
summary: The Bank of Thailand has introduced measures to reduce Thailand's high household debt ratio, which peaked at 96% of GDP in 2021. The central bank will conduct unscheduled visits to lenders to ensure they offer reasonable debt solutions, and banks that fail to comply may face penalties. A new debt restructuring program will be introduced, allowing borrowers to settle debts within five years at an interest rate of 15% or less. The program aims to reduce the country's $454 billion in outstanding household obligations.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: The Bank of Thailand logo is pictured in Bangkok, Thailand, August 5, 2016. Picture taken August 5, 2016.  To match Interview THAILAND-ECONOMY/CENBANK    REUTERS/Chaiwat Subprasom/File Photo

site_title: SGX reprimands former executive director of Eneco Energy for breaching listing rules
summary: The Singapore Exchange (SGX) has publicly reprimanded Aditya Wisnuwardana Seky Soeryadjaya, former group CEO and executive director of Eneco Energy, for breaching listing rules. Aditya failed to disclose timely updates on a material permit's expiry and circumvented internal protocols in the appointment of a vendor and disbursement of funds. As a result, Eneco Energy breached SGX's Mainboard Rule 703 and 719. Aditya is required to provide a signed written undertaking not to seek directorship or key executive officer roles on SGX-listed issuers for two-and-a-half years.

images.alt_text: Eneco Energy is being investigated for possible listing rule breaches after it failed to extend its West Rambi exploratory permit.

site_title: India's February retail inflation up faster than expected
summary: India's February retail inflation rose 5.09% from 5.10% in January, exceeding the forecast of 5.02% by a Reuters poll of 42 economists. Food inflation, accounting for nearly half of the overall consumer price basket, rose 8.66% in February, up from 8.30% in January. Despite retail inflation being within the 2-6% mandate, policymakers remain concerned about uncertainties in food prices. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has signaled it will not lower interest rates until it achieves inflation of 4% on a durable basis.

images.alt_text: New business has softened to a six-month low but has been in expansionary territory for over two-and-a-half years and orders from abroad remained resilient.

site_title: Hot stock: Seatrium falls as much as 11.2% amid heavy trading
summary: Seatrium's shares plummeted 11.2% on Monday, extending two days of losses, to reach a low of S$0.079. Analysts are mixed on the company's profit outlook, with DBS Group Research cutting its FY2024-25 profit forecasts by 13-16%. Seatrium aims for S$10-12 billion in revenue by 2028 and at least S$1 billion in earnings by 2028, with some analysts predicting a potential upside of 87.5-100%. Despite a "buy" rating from OCBC Investment Research, concerns remain over the company's ability to execute its strategic direction.

images.alt_text: Vivienne Tay
Seatrium logo at their office’s lobby, Oct 19, 2023.

site_title: UK to offer record £800 million support for offshore wind farms
summary: The UK government has announced a record £800 million annual support for offshore wind farms, tripling its previous budget. The move aims to scale up the industry and reduce costs, with the goal of tripling its fleet of offshore wind farms by the end of the decade. The increased support comes after last year's auction failed to attract bidders due to low government-offered prices. The £800 million will be used to support wind farms through the contracts for difference mechanism, guaranteeing a fixed price for electricity over 15 years.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: A survey vessel sails past wind turbines at the Burbo Bank offshore wind farm near New Brighton, Britain, January 23, 2023. REUTERS/Phil Noble/File Photo
Large clean energy installations for utilities are being stymied by permitting and grid interconnection delays and challenges sourcing equipment.

site_title: Daniel Boulud banks on familiar French food at Maison Boulud
summary: Daniel Boulud's new restaurant, Maison Boulud, at Marina Bay Sands in Singapore, offers classic French cuisine in a relaxed atmosphere. The menu features familiar dishes such as seafood platter, sole meuniere, charcuterie, and seared foie gras, all prepared competently. The restaurant's attention to detail is evident in its dishes, including a heartwarming creamy mushroom soup and a traditional cold meatloaf. Service is attentive but can be overly friendly, leaving dishes on the table for extended periods. Overall, Maison Boulud is a welcoming space that serves comforting, satisfying French food.

images.alt_text: Torno Subito's colourful beach-inspired interiors.

site_title: Tesla Germany halts work as Musk calls suspected arson 'extremely dumb'
summary: Tesla's European Gigafactory near Berlin was halted production and left without power after a suspected arson attack on a nearby electricity pylon. The blaze, which did not spread to the factory, was extinguished by the fire brigade. A letter from a far-left activist group, the Volcano Group, claimed responsibility for the attack, which was signed by a person using the name "Agua De Pau". Tesla's CEO Elon Musk called the attack "extremely dumb" and police are investigating the incident. The attack is the latest setback for Tesla in Europe, which has faced union pressure and supply disruptions.

images.alt_text: Tesla reduces prices for Model Y Long Range and Model Y Performance by 5,000 euros to 49,990 euros (S$73,073.24) and 55,990 euros respectively, representing a discount of 9 per cent and 8.1 per cent compared to the previous prices.

site_title: Japan government considers calling end to deflation, Kyodo reports
summary: Japan's government is considering declaring an end to deflation, a move that would mark a significant shift for the country's economy after decades of stagnation. Despite maintaining that Japan was no longer in deflation, the government may officially declare an end to the period of falling prices, citing rising inflation and market expectations that the Bank of Japan will exit its ultra-easy policy settings. A formal declaration would draw a line under nearly two decades of economic stagnation, with inflation having exceeded the BOJ's 2% target for over a year.

images.alt_text: Investor focus is now on this year’s wage negotiations, which could deliver more hefty pay hikes, a prerequisite for ending negative interest rates.

Both production and new orders, the two main subindexes of Japan's PMI, declined at the fastest pace in a year. Respondents cited factors such as weak sales demand at home and overseas as well as production delays due to machinery shutdowns.
Japan’s chronic labour crisis is worsening as the ageing and shrinking of the population accelerates.

Under its massive stimulus programme, the Bank of Japan currently guides short-term interest rates at minus 0.1 per cent, caps the 10-year government bond yield around 0 per cent and continues to buy huge amounts of assets such as government bonds.

site_title: South Korea to launch Asia’s first retail carbon-linked investment product
summary: South Korea plans to launch Asia's first retail carbon-linked investment product, exchange-traded notes (ETNs) linked to carbon allowances, by August this year. The move aims to boost liquidity in the country's sluggish carbon market, which has been hindered by an oversupply of free permits. The ETNs will track the performance of a carbon market index, with the goal of expanding participation and operating similarly to the European market. This is part of South Korea's efforts to stimulate its carbon market and address the permit oversupply problem, which the government plans to address by shrinking the total number of allowances and raising the cost of permits starting in 2026.

images.alt_text: Policymakers have said inflation could be volatile in February and March but are expected to continue stabilising afterwards.
South Korea's industrial output index fell 1.3 per cent over the month on a seasonally-adjusted basis, after a revised 0.5 per cent fall in December.
South Korea serves as a key link in global trade as its companies are positioned widely across a variety of supply chains.

site_title: Singapore adds S$300 million to kitty to boost tourism sector
summary: Singapore is adding S$300 million to its Tourism Development Fund to boost the tourism sector's post-pandemic recovery. The funds will support the development and marketing of new tourism products and experiences, including local enterprises and rejuvenating existing offerings. This move aims to attract 15-16 million visitors in 2024 and maintain international mindshare, strengthening Singapore's appeal as a destination. The fund will also help upskill tourism workers and enhance local tourism companies' productivity and innovation.

images.alt_text: The idea of Singapore paying Taylor Swift to only perform here does not sit well with some people
Taylor Swift’s six concerts in March could boost Singapore’s economy by up to S$500 million in tourism receipts, according to economists’ estimates.
Singapore's tourism performance benefitted from a “robust leisure and sporting events calendar” in 2023, says STB.

site_title: Luxury investments: Why these Singaporeans collect art, watches and wine
summary: A recent report by Knight Frank shows that luxury investments, including art, watches, and wine, saw mixed results in 2023. Art was the best-performing luxury asset class, with prices rising 11% in 2023, while watches returned a 5% gain. Wine, however, declined in value. A poll of ultra-rich individuals in Singapore found that art was the top choice for 58% of respondents, followed by watches and wine. Collectors, including Sharad Desai, Gerald Lum, and Linda Neo, share their passion for collecting, citing the enjoyment and personal connection they get from owning unique items.

images.alt_text: Towering in the heart of T3’s transit area, the new store – by far the largest of Lotte Duty Free’s in the world – sports an 8-metre LED media wall and an all-glass facade.
The Nov 25 sale features over 197 lots, most of which comprise of Hermes bags.

site_title: Digital Core Reit proposes to raise stake in Frankfurt data centre by 24.9%
summary: Digital Core Reit has proposed to raise its stake in a Frankfurt data centre by 24.9% to 49.9% through a €117 million (S$170.7 million) transaction, which requires unitholder approval. The acquisition is expected to be 3.2% accretive to annual distribution per unit, improving portfolio credit quality and enhancing geographical diversification. The data centre has 449,546 rentable square feet and features "blue-chip" tenants. The transaction will be funded by proceeds from the sale of Silicon Valley properties and a portion of the proceeds from a private placement.

images.alt_text: Tay Peck Gek
Digital Core Reit’s data centre in Northern Virginia. Under the equity fundraising scenario, the proposed transactions will expand the Reit’s geographical presence to 6 cities – up from 4 currently.
Following the listing of new units on Feb 20, the Reit's unit base will be enlarged to around 1.32 billion.
About 75 per cent of the gross proceeds raised will be used to fund potential acquisitions, says the manager.
John Stewart, the Reit manager’s chief executive, said a perceived peak in the US interest rate tightening cycle has spurred a recovery in the prices of Reit units.

site_title: Chen Xing Tong’s 250-metre drive outshines the competition at BT Golf League
summary: Teenage golfer Chen Xing Tong led Singapore Global Trust to the top of The Business Times Corporate Golf League with a 250-metre drive at the second leg, earning an eagle on Hole 7. SPH Sultans of Swing took second place with 105 points, ahead of Singapore Global Trust. Team Boss slipped from first to fourth after a late withdrawal of national player Denise Ng. The teams will compete again in the third leg on April 4.

images.alt_text: Team Hugo Boss players (from left) Becca Foe, Denise Ng, Marilyn Lum and Angelina Xiong.
Team Boss is fielding an all-female team at this year's BT Corporate Golf League. The event tees off on Thursday.

site_title: Norway wealth fund sells stakes in 3 Jardine firms on environment concerns
summary: Norway's $1.6 trillion sovereign wealth fund has sold its holdings in Jardine Matheson Holdings, Jardine Cycle & Carriage, and PT Astra International Tbk due to concerns over severe environmental damage, including the destruction of orangutan habitats. The decision was made after the fund's council on ethics recommended excluding the companies, citing the impact of PT Astra International's Martabe Gold Mine on the Tapanuli orangutan. The moves follow Norway's ethical mandate to preserve the country's oil revenues for future generations.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: A view shows the building of Norway’s central bank (Norges Bank) in Oslo, Norway, June 23, 2022.  REUTERS/Victoria Klesty/File Photo

site_title: Energy firms boost gas exploration in South-east Asia to meet growing demand
summary: Energy firms in South-east Asia are ramping up exploration activities to boost natural gas output and meet growing demand. Recent discoveries, including a major find by Mubadala Energy in the South Andaman Block, have drawn investments, with companies like TotalEnergies and Chevron acquiring stakes in Malaysian and Indonesian firms. Malaysia and Indonesia plan to award new production sharing contracts and explore more blocks, with increased flexibility in production sharing contracts and better fiscal terms attracting investments. The region is expected to see significant gas production growth, with demand peaking before 2040.

images.alt_text: Last week, Asia spot LNG prices hit their lowest levels in nearly three years as weak demand in Asia and Europe weighed on the market.
FILE PHOTO: A view shows a logo of Shell petrol station in South East London, Britain, February 2, 2023. REUTERS/May James//File Photo
Overall gas consumption across the globe is seen increasing by 2.5 per cent in 2024, with the Asia-Pacific region adding 4 per cent, followed by gas-rich countries in Africa and the Middle East.

site_title: China calls for new appliances, more vacation to revive spending
summary: China is urging citizens to trade in old appliances and cars for new ones, promising more paid vacation days to boost consumer spending amid a weak economy. Premier Li Qiang's annual work report also aims to strengthen consumer rights and interests. The country has seen disappointing retail sales growth and a property crisis, with per capita spending lower than before the Covid-19 pandemic. China aims for a 5% growth target in 2024, but policymakers must deliver more stimulus to meet expectations.

images.alt_text: China aims to issue such ultra long-term special bonds for several consecutive years, though Li Qiang's report did not include a target beyond 2024.

site_title: Challenging China's national drink is tall order for Western liquor makers
summary: Western liquor makers, such as Diageo and Pernod Ricard, are challenging China's dominant liquor, baijiu, to attract younger consumers. Despite baijiu's $167 billion market value, Western companies see an opportunity to grow their market share by targeting the rising middle class, millennials, and Generation Z. To compete, Western companies are launching new products, such as whiskey lattes and cognac, and partnering with local companies to expand their reach. However, the baijiu market's strong presence and cultural significance may limit Western companies' success in the short term.

images.alt_text: Many companies expected that these young consumers would start pouring their money into the financial markets, leading a nationwide shift away from property as a source of wealth.
Xtra's UHNW Chinese clients favour brands like Tom Dixon, whose Melt modern lights are pictured here.
Budweiser, despite producing some of the US’s most popular and affordable beers, is considered a status product by label-hungry Chinese drinkers.

site_title: Nationwide challenges UK's big banks with US$3.7 billion Virgin Money bid
summary: Nationwide Building Society has agreed to buy Virgin Money UK in a $3.7 billion all-cash deal, creating the UK's second-largest savings and mortgage provider. The deal, valued at approximately £366.3 billion, would increase competition in Britain's mortgage and savings market. Analysts expect the transaction to boost bank stocks, which have been under pressure due to geopolitical tensions and economic growth concerns. The deal, if approved, would allow Nationwide to offer a wider range of products and services, while Virgin Money's 7,300-strong workforce would remain intact.

images.alt_text: A Nationwide Building Society branch in Middlesbrough, UK, on Thursday, March 7, 2024. Nationwide Building Society has reached a preliminary agreement to buy Virgin Money UK Plc for £2.9 billion ($3.7 billion), in a deal that raises the stakes for consolidation among Britain’s mid-sized lenders. Photographer: Ian Forsyth/Bloomberg

site_title: To find great values in Italian wine, look to Abruzzo
summary: The Abruzzo region in Italy is experiencing a wine renaissance, thanks to a new generation of growers and winemakers dedicated to conscientious farming and meticulous winemaking. Montepulciano d'Abruzzo, a popular red wine, has seen a significant improvement in quality, while whites and rosés are also gaining recognition. Producers such as Tiberio, Cirelli Wines, De Fermo, Colle Florido, and Antica Tenuta Pietramore are producing exceptional wines that showcase the region's unique terroir and identity. These estates, often small and family-owned, are prioritizing traditional methods and sustainable practices, resulting in wines that are both delicious and authentic.

images.alt_text: A life of wine
Does wine lose its spirit when the alcohol is removed?

site_title: Australia’s ANZ sells 16.5% interest in Malaysian lender AmBank for RM2.1 billion
summary: ANZ Group sold 16.5% interest in Malaysian lender AmBank for approximately RM2.1 billion (S$596 million). The sale reduces ANZ's stake to 5.2% and is part of the bank's strategy to shrink low-returning business lines and boost return on equity. The deal is expected to increase ANZ's CET1 ratio by 16 basis points without impacting profits, and may lead to a higher dividend yield for future shareholder payments.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: A pedestrian is reflected in the window of a branch of the Australia and New Zealand Banking Group (ANZ) in central Sydney, Australia, October 25, 2017. REUTERS/Steven Saphore/File Photo

site_title: One of the world’s best sandwiches is coming to Miami
summary: A renowned Japanese chef, Kentaro Nakahara, is opening a 10-seat wagyu beef-focused restaurant in Miami's Design District. His signature wagyu katsu sando, considered one of the world's best sandwiches, will be available only through his 10-course, $350 omakase. The dish features an A5 wagyu chateaubriand, fried to order, and served with butter-slathered milk bread and soy-infused tare sauce. The restaurant, opening in November, will also feature other Japanese specialties, including 16-hour-simmered oxtail soup and a 20-vegetable salad, all showcasing the chef's dedication to sumibi and binchotan cooking.

site_title: Manhattan apartment rents climb during busy February for leasing
summary: Manhattan apartment rents rose 3.3% in February to a median of $4,230, driven by a strong economy and tight sales market. Relatively low unemployment and high mortgage rates have made buying a property tougher, leading many to rent. Prices in Brooklyn climbed 2.9% to $3,499 and in northwest Queens, median rents rose 1% to $3,239. The market is expected to remain busy as spring approaches, with rent increases anticipated in the coming season.

images.alt_text: A view of Manhattan from the roof of the Madison Square Park Tower at 45 East 22nd Street in New York, U.S., on Thursday, May 18, 2017. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

site_title: A US$2.1 billion Invesco fund offers way to invest in water risks
summary: A US$2.1 billion Invesco fund is the largest investment option for water risks, with other highly-rated funds including Calvert Global Water and Virtus Duff & Phelps Water. Analysts say investing in water is gaining traction due to rising demand and scarcity of clean water. The funds focus on expanding access to water, improving quality, and addressing other challenges. Despite market challenges, water funds have performed relatively well, with some gaining up to 12% in the past three years, and are considered a thematic investment opportunity.

images.alt_text: epa11237556 A rower sails near the Vermelha Beach (Red Beach) on the eve of the World Water Day, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, 21 March 2024 (issued 22 March 2024). World Water Day is celebrated annually on 22 March. This year's theme is 'Water for Peace,' emphasizing the potential of water as a catalyst for harmony and cooperation among communities. According to data from the World Bank, the World Health Organization (WHO), and Unicef, 771 million people do not have access to basic safe drinking water services, and 3.5 billion people lack safe sanitation services.  EPA-EFE/ANDRE COELHO

site_title: India to lower EV import tax if US$500 million invested, boosting Tesla plans
summary: India plans to lower import taxes on electric vehicles (EVs) for companies investing at least $500 million in the country over three years. The policy, aimed at attracting global EV manufacturers, allows companies to import a limited number of EVs at 15% tax, down from 70-100%. The goal is to strengthen the EV ecosystem and promote healthy competition, with a cap of 8,000 EVs per year. This move may boost Tesla's plans to enter the Indian market.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: Model Y cars are pictured during the opening ceremony of the new Tesla Gigafactory for electric cars in Gruenheide, Germany, March 22, 2022. Patrick Pleul/Pool via REUTERS/File Photo
